reviews.review_msg: Course was graded largely on weekly assignments and quizzes, so you have to stay on top of things. That being said Jane is specific with what she expects from the assignments so its not hard to do well on them. Overall great prof.
worst
all graphs
she is really funny and her lectures are really clear. However, she speaks really quick. If English is not your first language, maybe you need 2 weeks to get used to her speed.
very straight forward. no tricky questions in midterms. assignments are easy.
Her notes are complement to the textbook. Do the practice questions for the midterm and final. Recommended
No Comments
don't take her class if you like to reads a lot of paper
hard course!!!
i dun like her. she is not helpful

1/3 of the class failed on the midterm.she doesn't respond to certain students' email and is very mean during office hour. I read each article that she claimed to be important at least 4 times. and still got a D on the midterm.

Some people said her text is actually helpful..I dont know... b/c in 381 there was only her note and these notes were really helpful and clear and easy to understand. Labour market is interesting and there isn't much work required for the course overall, except 1 actually research assignment

Hmm, she got a bad rating, but is a terrific prof. The course in interesting, but if you're not into it, I don't know how you'll do well. If you can relate this to the real world, you'll do fine. Lots of 'why' questions and stuff like essays.
I really like her.  She is a nice person.  Her lecture notes can be confusing at times, but if you actually go to her office and ask questions, you will do well in this course.
awesome proff!!!!I learned so much in that class...though..it was a lot of work but was worth it.she knows what she is doing!lovedddddddddddd that course
Midterm is hard, but the Final Exam is easy
Very hard course. She is a nice person with terrible terrible teaching.  Don't take this course unless you really have to..
The midterm is easy and similar to the assignment.   (the class average is above 82%) The final is much harder.  Remember NOT to buy the test book ...she hasn't use it at all.

Lectures are informative and interesting, and she speaks at the right pace. If you want an A in this class, you need to know BEYOND the basics that are offered in classes, such as combining theories to answer questions. She has an amazing wardrobe, too.
i think this is one of the easiest upper level course in econ...and it was really interesting too!

This class was one of the more interesting courses that I have taken as a econ major.  I dont know why all the poor ratings below, maybe because econ is new to you. I thought she was a good prof.  You just need to study the class notes.
No Comments
she is very very very lazy

Took 2nd time w/him after 382. Excellent prof. NO QUESTION. Only problem of this course is having 301 as pre-requisite and not some Stat course instead! Too much STAT concepts used and NOT covering enough STAT concepts in class! I could see students having hard time w/ this course due to NO STAT BACKGROUND! Other than that fair marking on Final.
His lecture notes is well-organized. Just that I prefer powerpoint notes as his hand-writing is reli hard to read. Overall, one of the best Profs @ econ department.
He is great. He never comes to class late. He puts efforts in teaching as well as encouraging students to answer questions. Well-prepared. I just wonder why he is hired in limited terms.

Final is harder than I expected, but it's not mission impossible. The foundation is supply-demand, plus some new concepts related to labor markets. This course is really boring itself. In my opinion, he taught well.

Summer 2005. His Final is really hard. It is impossible to pass the final exam. Hopefully he will scale down the final. Overall the class should be a easy one. His midterm and assignments are quite easy.
Useless to attend lectures. Dunno how to teach.
unclear lecture,just stay home and read the text, attending his lecture is just wasting your time since you won't understand his english
Lectures follow text really closely.  If you read the text this course will be easy, but if you don't it'll be really tough.  He has strong background knowledge and is really helpful and friendly.
He just uses the textbook's powerpoint, and doesn't know how to teach. Exams and assignments are tricky. He should learn how to teach before he teaches everyone.

His class material is heavy but good thing is you can bring cheatsheet. The key to have good grade in this course is practice his exam practice and try to remember them. The both 2 midterm show up again a lot in the final exam so definitely look at the midterm for the final.

Informative but occasionally dull lectures, manageable exams with plenty of revision materials. Your grade would likely correlate with your effort for this one: understand the lectures, practice past papers and you should be more than able to obtain a decent grade
